metadata.title: CVE-2010-0301 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
main.C in maildrop 2.3.0 and earlier, when run by root with the -d option,uses the gid of root for execution of the .mailfilter file in a user's homedirectory, which allows local users to gain privileges via a crafted file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2010-0301` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

maildrop - 2.7.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: maildrop package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.7.1-1').
